info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 25 at 5:48PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 46 below zero between West Glacier and Marias Pass. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero at Bad Rock Canyon. Periods of light to moderate snow expected through Sunday combined with wind gusts to 40 mph will create blowing and drifting snow at times. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, and Marias Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Blowing snow will reduce visibility to less than one mile at times. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
